intro: Anigozanthos humilis subsp. chrysanthus, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub with bright orange to red floral spikes that bloom during the warmer months. The plant features narrow, strap-like leaves and is well adapted to arid and coastal environments. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its unique appearance and seasonal flowering make it a popular choice in native gardens.
